Experience Sr. Director, Executive Recruiting Yahoo March 2015  – Present (6 months) San Francisco Bay Area Yahoo is focused on making the world's daily habits inspiring and entertaining - whether you're searching the web, emailing friends, sharing photos with family, or simply checking the weather, sports scores or stock quotes. 
 
We create highly personalized experiences that keep our users connected to the things that matter most, across devices and around the world. In turn, we deliver value for advertisers by connecting them with the right audiences. 
 
If you would like to learn more about Yahoo's world-class leadership and talent, I encourage you to visit http://info.yahoo.com - as well as download the latest releases of our award-winning mobile apps for iOS and Android. Director, Executive Recruiting Yahoo June 2013  –  February 2015  (1 year 9 months) San Francisco Bay Area Director - Executive Talent Transformation jcpenney December 2011  –  June 2013  (1 year 7 months) San Francisco Bay Area Having worked with and for Ron Johnson (CEO), Dan Walker (Talent Chief), and Michael Francis (President) at both Apple and Target, I was brought onboard as one of the founding members of the Talent Transformation Team. Our mission was to fuel the transformation of one of America's greatest brands with an overabundance of top talent. Initially, we built out a national talent acquisition team to serve our clients across all corporate functions and stores. My team and I were responsible for hiring top leaders in Human Resources, Talent Acquisition, Marketing, & Product Development & Design. My role evolved to focus solely on the executive talent transformation across the most "specialized" retail functions of Merchandising & Stores. Personally responsible for 5 VP & several Director placements in 2012 alone. Executive Search & Talent Advisor Global Talent Acquisition Consultant May 2010  –  November 2011  (1 year 7 months) San Francisco Bay Area Worked with top consumer electronics, technology, and retail clients to source & recruit diverse talent. Talent Acquisition Leader - Marketing & Target.com Target February 2008  –  April 2010  (2 years 3 months) Minneapolis, MN Drove strategic planning & execution of talent acquisition efforts as Target.com embarked on a 2-year, $150 million re-platforming effort. Challenged both new & experienced recruiters to think critically, build strong relationships, & manage their business independently while achieving metrics & driving great hiring results for our clients. Sought out to lead Target Clinic recruitment – corporate & stores - as company brought growing healthcare business back in-house & planned expansion into new states. Received HR Award for Excellence in first quarter with company for successful initiative. 
 
Chair, GLBT Diversity Business Council (concurrent with TA role) 
Selected by HR executive leadership to chair Target’s effort to drive diversity & inclusion initiatives in the workplace & marketplace. Represented the brand at industry & community events. Guided the team effort to earn the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index perfect score of 100 for the first time in company history. Manager, Global Recruiting Operations - Retail & Corporate Apple April 2006  –  January 2008  (1 year 10 months) Cupertino, CA Asked to lead the projects, programs & systems side of the Global Recruitment Operations team based on my work and reputation with colleagues in both the corporate & retail talent teams. Streamlined recruitment systems & processes via a full-scale, multi-million dollar implementation & integration of a Global Applicant Tracking System (ADP/VirtualEdge). Responsible for the re-launch of the full-cycle Apple candidate experience: from Career Center (www.apple.com/jobs), to online application, employee referral program, EEO/OFCCP compliance, background investigations, offer letters, & on-boarding. Sr. Recruiter - Worldwide Marketing Apple June 2004  –  April 2006  (1 year 11 months) Cupertino, CA Partnered with senior executives, including Phil Schiller, to bring top-level talent into Apple’s world-premier marketing organization. Viewed as an integral business partner - a true marketing team member who anticipated needs & was ahead of the curve in proactively driving headcount via “passive candidate” talent acquisition for iPod, Mac Hardware, Mac OSX, Developer Relations, and Corporate PR/Communications. Sr. Recruiter - Global Retail Apple March 2001  –  May 2004  (3 years 3 months) Cupertino, CA Charter team member of a small group who ultimately built the recruiting function (for all retail positions – stores & corporate) from the ground up. Continuously innovated processes & scaled our operation domestically and overseas to over 100 stores in 3 years. Hired over 1000 team members on my own while also developing processes and tools to train stores on how to be self-sufficient in their key volume recruiting time-frames. 
 
Led the staffing launch of Apple Retail in Japan. Coordinated the cross-functional work of store management as well as staffing agencies, recruiters, coordinators and interpreters. Worked with local HR on labor laws, contracts and customs. Ultimately hired over 200 Japanese team members in flagship stores in Tokyo & Osaka. Senior Merchandising Manager Marshall Field's (Department Store Division) November 1998  –  February 2001  (2 years 4 months) Minneapolis, MN Managed a $175 Million, 60-store business for the Marshall Field’s Department Store Division of Target (now a part of Macy’s Inc). Led a team of 15 Business Analysts across three business units. Recruited, developed, and promoted high-potential merchant talent across the organization. Promoted from Buyer role in Better Cosmetics. Specialize in Women's RTW & Cosmetics. Buyer May Department Stores 1994  –  1998  (4 years) St. Louis, MO May Department Stores Company was an industry-leading retailer that was acquired by Macy's/Federated in 2005. May Company's Executive Training program was a premier program that grew, trained, and ultimately fed retail leadership talent across the world today. 
 
Buyer, Better Sportswear (1997 - 1998)  
Executive Trainee, Assistant Buyer, Department Manager, Buyer-in-Training (1994 - 1997) Sr. Director, Executive Recruiting Yahoo March 2015  – Present (6 months) San Francisco Bay Area Yahoo is focused on making the world's daily habits inspiring and entertaining - whether you're searching the web, emailing friends, sharing photos with family, or simply checking the weather, sports scores or stock quotes. 
 
We create highly personalized experiences that keep our users connected to the things that matter most, across devices and around the world. In turn, we deliver value for advertisers by connecting them with the right audiences.

Summary I'm a Senior Recruiter at Marketo. I support the recruiting efforts for G&A. 
 
Marketo is the leader in digital marketing software and solutions. Digital, social and mobile technologies have forever altered the way organizations and marketers need to interact with people. Organizations need to engage with people in order to build meaningful and personalized relationships over time, instead of talking at them. We call it engagement marketing. 
 
As a full cycle Recruiter: 
I'm responsible for the complete hiring process. Upon being contacted by my client manager and assisting with the job/budget approval. 
I work with the team/manager to generate a quality pool of candidates. Being passive search, active search and referral programs. The interview process varies on the location of my managers and their schedule. 
I assist and drive the complete process as far as generating/mailing the offer to the candidate. Offer follow-up and candidate on-boarding also were my priorities. 
 
Specialties: Ability to build strong business relationships with all levels of management and candidates 
Experience with multiple applicant tracking systems 
Consultative Staffing Approach, Candidate Sourcing and Selection, Relationship Building 
Self-motivated professional with exceptional work ethic

Summary Whether an employee or helping job-seekers find work, if you prefer “professional Haig” on the left, I will not disappoint. The informal Haig on the right has proven to fit in anywhere -- even if he’s dressed in a business suit at a luau. Thoughtful, tactful, analytical, innovative, tenacious, focused, collaborative, decisive, proactive: These are words that describe me in the workplace ... and "fun."  
 
Performed and managed full-cycle recruiting responsibilities for companies traversing growth technologies from PC sub-systems to video encoders/decoders, 3D graphic controllers, broadband networking, enterprise solutions, NAND, Solid State Drives, and storage virtualization. 
 
Combined innovative sourcing strategies with routine cold-calling campaigns. Internet sourcing sleuth who has never suffered from the PCRS (phone call reluctance syndrome). 
 
Prior to high-tech recruiting I spent several years in sales and marketing management including six years with an international consulting company in Managing for Quality, Juran Institute (www.juran.com). Juran Institute fostered my problem solving skills and introduced me to practices and processes such as market analysis, cost reduction, Customer Quality, Quality Improvement, and project planning – shaping my work ethic to this day. Summary I’m so excited to be part of LinkedIn’s Mission every single day: “Connect the world’s professionals to make them more productive and successful”. As a Corporate Recruiter at the most transformative company in the world, I’m able to be taking part in helping “Create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce”.

I’m incredibly passionate about what I do and I’m able to make an impact on individual’s lives on a daily basis.
